author: Shistavanen_brick
title: The Lion-tribe King!
review:
Chima-speedorz pop up everywhere in stores it seems, but lately it seems like they go on sale way faster than "normal" in 2013. The Legends Of Chima line suffers from many problems in my opinion. Compared to Ninjago (which had its fun moments, my kids enjoyed the show & even I thought it had a cool plot), Chima suffers from a bad backstory. The semi-Yoda-wisdom and knowledge of Chi, Legend beasts and what have you, seems a bit too deep for younger children. Older kids might be scared off by the naive tone in the tv-show. 

Which in itself is too bad since the detailing in all Chima minifigures and innovative design for vehicles excel and surpasses many other themes out there. I do believe the theme has potential and hopefully the tide will turn to save the theme before it gets discontinued. I'd love to see other tribes (tigers, bears, pelicans, elks, squirrels, elephants and so on) released in the future. Well, enough about my rant, what about THIS set?

The set.

It comes with one minifigure, gaming cards for the Chima game, chi crystals and a very much lion-like speedor - with a rip-cord. In addition there are a few weapon pieces with translucent blue pieces. Two cool items are the gold lightsaber handles, if you are a Star Wars fan. If you are into the game this all surely makes perfect sense. It also contains parts to build a tower to direct your speedor towards. Have you got what it takes to take down the blue ball from the top with the speedor? My daughter and I tried it and it is kind of tricky, not your easy bullseye homerun.

Minifigure.

Lagravis, the king of the lion-tribe, is absolutely amazing! He has lots of royal gold printing on torso and legs, very detailed and very cool. Most of the colouring apart from the lion-colour goes in blue and gold. The head piece is fantastic too, as always with these tribes. A head over the actual LEGO head, so to speak. To top it off, he sports a blue cloak to make it clear that he is the KING! It might be the cheapest way to get him at the moment, if you don't want to spend money on the Lion Chi Temple to get him.


Pros:
  • Fantastic minifigure, top notch!
  • Generous ammount of extra pieces.
  • Nice colours.
Cons:
  • A bit unmeaning unless you are into the game.

author: Patch22
title: 70108: Royal Roost Review
review:
I got this set today, I think it's a pretty good set, though it is very simple to build,but the Speedor is

one of my favourite ones so far.

Box/Instructions

Well, it is a Blister pack,but the packaging is just like most other Chima speedorz' packaging, that
you have to tear it apart to get into it, 
The Packaging shows Lagravis on his Speedor, smashing into the tower.
the packaging also has a Chi Orb, with the Number 11 on it,As this is the 11th Speedorz set.

Parts

The set has some Cool parts, It has four Cream Clip Pieces, which has only came in 13 sets.
The set also has four 1x2x3 Roof Tile piece, in flame yellowish orange(as it's called on Brickset)
And The set has a gold Speedor, it has great detail.

Minifigures

The only Minifigure in the set is Lagravis,He is Very Detailed, He has a grey Mane and a dark blue cape,The Dark blue only comes in six sets. His legs are the same as all the other
Lions (apart from Longtooth), This is also the cheapest way to get Lagravis.
The one thing I wish they could have included is a Chi harness.

The build

The Build is very simple, It took me about ten minutes, it is not the most exciting build,
though it is still quite fun.

The completed model

The Completed Model is pretty Cool, It is quite easy to play, so if your looking for something harder then I'd recommend Nest Dive.
When you hit the Tower it Breaks into four parts, it is quite Fun and has some good pieces.
And Lagravis' Golden Speedor is Definitely one of my Favourite speedorz.
you get Five cards A character card (Lagravis), A Chi weapon card (Honorous), A power up
card (Kuttor), A speedor card (Defendor II) and Another weapon Card (Fangjabber).
Summary

A great set and it is also good value, If your into Chima or Speedorz, Then I'd say it's worth Buying.
